alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 1:05PM EDT until April 16 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: .Unseasonably warm temperatures have led to rapid snowmelt, causing small streams to overflow their banks. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following county, Marquette. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 103 PM EDT, M-DOT reported flooding in the advisory area at M-35 by County Road MK, as only one lane of alternating traffic is open. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palmer. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
